snippet: The company issued an “urgent agenda” memo to managers, pushing them to improve performance on fresh items, reflecting customer complaints about food quality.
abstract: Highly sensitive memo issued by Walmart in October to its managers across country, pushing them to improve performance on fresh dairy, meat and produce items, reflects customer complaints about quality of food offered by discount retailer; memo was leaked for public use by manager unhappy about understaffing, and some retail analysts agree that Walmart does not have enough employees in its stores.

byline.original: By STEVEN GREENHOUSE and HIROKO TABUCHI

lead_paragraph: The company issued an “urgent agenda” memo to managers, pushing them to improve performance on fresh items, reflecting customer complaints about food quality.

headline.main: Walmart Memo Orders Stores to Improve Grocery Performance
